eg.document

Class UndoEdit

  • java.lang.Object
    • eg.document.UndoEdit

  • public class UndoEdit
extends java.lang.Object
    The undo and redo editing.

    Calling undo undoes edits until a breakpoint is reached. The next undo would proceed to the next breakpoint etc.. Redo runs in the same way in the opposite direction. Breakpoints are added when the text change is a newline, when the direction, that is insertion and removal, changes and when the change is longer than one character. Additional occasions for breakpoints can be added from outside by markBreakpoint(). Adding a new edit while edits are undone (and not redone) removes the undone edits.

    Created in TypingEdit which adds edits and also adds breakpoints when the cursor is moved with the mouse or cursor keys.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      UndoEdit(TextDocument textDoc) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean canRedo()
      Returns the boolean that indicates if edits can be redone
      boolean canUndo()
      Returns the boolean that indicates if edits can be undone
      void markBreakpoint()
      Marks that the last edit will be a breakpoint as soon as another edit is added.
      void redo()
      Redoes edits up to the next breakpoint that is located behind the edits that are undone and not yet redone
      void undo()
      Undoes edits up to the next breakpoint that is located before the edits that are not yet undone

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • markBreakpoint

        public void markBreakpoint()
        Marks that the last edit will be a breakpoint as soon as another edit is added. This is effectless if the edit is already a breakpoint
